greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Remainder when sum of first n terms of the Hofstadter Q-sequence is divided by 2*n.
comment: Sequence represents c(n, 2) where c(n, i) = (Sum_{k = 1..n} A005185(k)) mod (n*i). See also A283025 and corresponding illustration in Links section.
link: Altug Alkan, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Altug Alkan, Illustration Of Residue Classes Modulo 8
example: a(4) = 7 since Sum_{k = 1..4} A005185(k) = 1 + 1 + 2 + 3 = 7 and remainder when 7 is divided by 8 is 7.
maple: A005185:= proc(n) option remember; procname(n-procname(n-1)) +procname(n-procname(n-2)) end proc:
seq(L[i] mod (2*i), i=1..1000); # after _Robert Israel_ at A283025
mathematica: a[1] = a[2] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = a[n - a[n - 1]] + a[n - a[n - 2]]; Table[Mod[Total@ Array[a, n], 2 n], {n, 84}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 13 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a=vector(1000); a[1]=a[2]=1; for(n=3, #a, a[n]=a[n-a[n-1]]+a[n-a[n-2]]); vector(#a, n, sum(k=1, n, a[k]) % (2*n))
results.author: _Altug Alkan_, Mar 09 2017
